content:
Let me propose a simplified KISS (Keep It Simple, Stupid) implementation for Course 1:

FRONTEND (Next.js)
1. Three simple pages:
- /course/module-1 (Swarm Basics)
- /course/module-2 (Economics)
- /course/module-3 (Analysis)

Each page contains:
- Content section (text + images)
- 10 multiple choice questions
- Progress indicator
- "Submit" button

BACKEND (Express)
1. Two main endpoints:
- POST /submit-module (saves scores)
- POST /claim-reward (triggers smart contract)

DATABASE (MongoDB)
1. Simple schema:
```
User {
  address: string
  moduleScores: [number]
  completionStatus: boolean
  lastAttempt: date
}
```

SMART CONTRACT (Solidity)
1. Single function flow:
- User completes all modules
- Backend verifies 80% score
- Smart contract sends 10,000 $COMPUTE

We can build this in 2 weeks:
Week 1: Course content + frontend
Week 2: Backend + rewards integration

Should we proceed with this simplified approach?
